parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandatory for electoral campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to "Brian Cristian," identifying him as a candidate.  The hashtags #briancristian, #briancristian2024, #briancristiandeputat further reinforce this. The mention of  "Elena Lasconi" and "Lasconi președinte" is problematic, as it could be interpreted as an attempt to leverage another candidate's popularity to boost Brian Cristian's image.  However, the context suggests it's more likely a reference to a political alliance or shared political views rather than a direct endorsement.  The overall context points towards "Article 36 (7) - a" applying.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The hashtags and general message are not targeted at specific individuals but aim for broader appeal. Therefore, "Article 36 (7) - c" applies.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's core message urges voters to "choose people who work for you," implicitly advocating for Brian Cristian.  Phrases like "Un ales trebuie să fie vocea comunității!" (An elected official must be the voice of the community!) and "Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi" (Choose people who work for you) directly encourage voting for a specific type of candidate, strongly suggesting an electoral objective. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. While it mentions parliamentary activity, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. The language is overtly persuasive and promotional, aiming to influence voters' choices.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content transcends personal opinion. It's a carefully crafted message designed to promote a specific candidate and influence electoral outcomes, not merely express a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1113515196939145</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The presence of a CMF number, direct reference to Brian Cristian as a candidate, the use of persuasive language aimed at influencing voters' choices, and the paid nature of the Facebook post all strongly indicate that this is electoral propaganda. The post's objective is clearly to increase votes for Brian Cristian. While the mention of Elena Lasconi might be open to interpretation, the overall context points towards a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1113515196939145) cu conținut electoral, ce promovează candidatura lui Brian Cristian, folosind un limbaj persuasiv și un număr CMF (CMF 11240015), având drept efect electoral creșterea numărului de voturi pentru acesta.  Postarea, plătită de USR Maramureș, conține afirmații precum „Un ales trebuie să fie vocea comunității!” și „Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi”,  care îndeamnă direct la vot pentru un anumit tip de candidat, depășind limitele activității jurnalistice și constituind propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
